intro: Acronychia arfakensis, commonly known as the Arfakensis acronychia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Burseraceae. It is native to the rainforests of northern Queensland, Australia, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. It produces small, yellowish flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits that contain a single seed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
